directions.dialogText: In this activity, we are going to store text, or string, values in our variables. In the code panel, type the correct words between the quotes (\`' '\`) then run your code to check it.

levels.mission: In the code panel, after the \`=\`, type the correct words between the quotes (\`' '\`). Then run your code to check it.
levels.tools:
\`word1\`- variable meant to hold string values

\`word2\`- variable meant to hold string values

sentences: I brush my teeth ______ go to bed.

directions.dialogText: Give each variable the correct string value based on the sentences on the board. This time, you will have to type the quotes (\`' '\`) yourself.

levels.mission: In the code panel, after the \`=\`, type the correct words between quotes (\`' '\`). Then run your code to check it.
levels.tools:
\`word1\`- variable meant to hold string values

\`word2\`- variable meant to hold string values

sentences: Your lunch is ______ on the table.

directions.dialogText: Ok! Looks like you've got the hang of it. From now on, you will have to write all the code yourself. Good luck!

levels.mission: Create a variable for each missing word and give it the correct value. For example, to create word1, you'd type \`var word1 = '';\` Then put the correct word between the \`''\`s.
